sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with singular matrices
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method:
$$\begin{cases} 3x-y+4z=7 \\ x+y+2z=4 \\ 2x-2y+8z=14 \end{cases}$$
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method, we first write the augmented matrix:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & -1 & 4 & 7 \\
1 & 1 & 2 & 4 \\
2 & -2 & 8 & 14
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 1: Eliminate x from the second and third rows.

Divide the first row by 3:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
1 & 1 & 2 & 4 \\
2 & -2 & 8 & 14
\end{array}\right]
$$

Subtract the first row from the second row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
0 & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{2}{3} & \frac{5}{3} \\
2 & -2 & 8 & 14
\end{array}\right]
$$

Subtract twice the first row from the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
0 & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{2}{3} & \frac{5}{3} \\
0 & -\frac{4}{3} & 4 & 6
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 2: Eliminate y from the third row.

Divide the second row by $\frac{4}{3}$:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
0 & 1 & \frac{1}{2} & \frac{5}{4} \\
0 & -\frac{4}{3} & 4 & 6
\end{array}\right]
$$

Add $\frac{4}{3}$ times the second row to the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
0 & 1 & \frac{1}{2} & \frac{5}{4} \\
0 & 0 & \frac{10}{3} & \frac{23}{4}
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 3: Solve for z.

Divide the third row by $\frac{10}{3}$:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -\frac{1}{3} & \frac{4}{3} & \frac{7}{3} \\
0 & 1 & \frac{1}{2} & \frac{5}{4} \\
0 & 0 & 1 & \frac{23}{10}
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now we have z:

$$
z = \frac{23}{10}
$$

Step 4: Solve for y.

Substitute z back into the second row:

$$
y + \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{23}{10} = \frac{5}{4}
$$

Solve for y:

$$
y = \frac{5}{4} - \frac{23}{20} = \frac{1}{20}
$$

Step 5: Solve for x.

Substitute y and z back into the first row:

$$
x - \frac{1}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{20} + \frac{4}{3} \cdot \frac{23}{10} = \frac{7}{3}
$$

Solve for x:

$$
x = \frac{7}{3} + \frac{1}{60} - \frac{92}{30} = \frac{1}{60}
$$

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

$$
x = \frac{1}{60}, \quad y = \frac{1}{20}, \quad z = \frac{23}{10}
$$
